main_text:
Alexander Gottlieb Baumgarten
4. Alexander Gottlieb Baumgarten

A. G. Baumgarten is best known for authoring the textbook in
metaphysics that Kant used for his lectures on the topic, though he
was an important and innovative thinker in his own right. His
philosophical ambitions are, moreover, deeply informed by the
controversy in Halle, as he had an abiding intellectual sympathy with
Wolffianism but theological and personal connections to the Pietists.
Among his students was the notable Wolffian philosopher Georg
Friedrich Meier (1717–77), and his own influence extended to
Kant but also to Moses Mendelssohn and J. G. Herder.
entry_title: 18th Century German Philosophy Prior to Kant
